turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi there. Good morning. I'm Doctor <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> <UNSURE>from GP at Hand</UNSURE>. Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Hi</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, um, before we start your appointment. Could I confirm your full name and date of birth please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>, it's John Smith, and I am thirty two years old.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sorry, I didn't catch your date of birth.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm thirty two years old.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Thirty two years old, OK. Could you tell me the first line of your address, and <UNSURE>your</UNSURE> postcode please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It's four Park Avenue, and it's AB one CB two.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's great, thank you so much for that. Are you in a private place where you're OK to speak at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So how can I help you today? You've been having some problems with your asthma. Is that right?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sorry, say that <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How can I help you today?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: So, um, I've been experiencing very weird symptoms, over the past month or so.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I <UNSURE>don't know</UNSURE> what's causing them. I have googled it and, um, nothing's coming up, so I thought I'd come and speak to you about it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, tell me a bit more about these weird symptoms you've been having.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: So, it started with, feeling very tired, but for a couple of days, and then I get back to normal.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And then I started losing feeling, in my hands and arms. I get a weird sensation like, uh, I guess, pins and needles.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Right</UNSURE> <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> again, the connection's not so great. You've been getting pins and needles in the hand. Is that right?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, that's correct.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Is that the right or left hand?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: My right hand.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is it always the right?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, we've lost video now, maybe is there a, a, a button you can press?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Are you happy for us to carry on without the video? I can't see you at the moment.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, that's fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. Um, so, you've been having these pins and needles, <UNSURE>and</UNSURE> episodes of numbness, in the right hand. Is it just the hand, or does it go up the arm as well?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, the pins and needles are in the hand, but I feel like my arm is getting weaker, but it only lasts few days and then goes back to normal. So, it's very weird.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Um, is <UNSURE>there</UNSURE> any involvement of your leg at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, my, colleague said, I'm walking slightly differently to normal.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And again, it's only for three days, or three or four days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. You, you said you've been having weird symptoms for about a month.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, so, what has been happening from the beginning of the month? What else has been <UNSURE>happening</UNSURE>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I generally feel tired, and weak.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And, sometimes I feel nauseous, and I don't feel like I want to do anything.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and, um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You know, <UNIN/>, your colleague said you've, you've not been walking normally.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Do you feel anything different, on either side, in terms of your legs? Can <UNIN/>, have you noticed anything different?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>, so, at the same time I get my arm symptoms, my leg feels weaker.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You know you, the abnormal gait. Has that been present, outside of these episodes?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, it has not. So normally, I'm, fit and well actually.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right, OK. Um, and, these, these episodes. How often have they been happening?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: They have been getting more regular. So at the start, it would be maybe once a week, uh, to every once <UNIN/>, once a month, but now it's getting uh, uh, a couple of times a day.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. And, how long have these episodes been going on for? When, when did it all start? Was it a month ago?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, probably a month and a half, maybe two months.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, along with these symptoms, of the weakness and numbness. Do you have any other symptoms at the same time? Like swallowing, or difficulty speaking, or vision problems?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: So, recently I've noticed, I can't hold my cup of coffee.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And when I, do drink coffee, it's slightly harder to drink.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And that's only been in the last couple of days, I guess.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right. Is that during these episodes, or outside of these episodes?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Only during the episodes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Do you have any difficulty swallowing at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not currently, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>. During the episodes, do you have any difficulty swallowing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I, I, I feel like there's something in my throat.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. What about, <UNIN/> um, difficulty speaking during these episodes? Any, any issues with that at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I can speak fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And any visual problems during these episodes?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>I</UNSURE>, I don't think so, but I wear glasses.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. Now um, can I just ask? <UNIN/>, has, uh, is there any history of stroke, or mini-strokes in your family?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yes. My, father has had a, operation to the side of his neck, to reduce the risk of stroke.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and, uh, how about yourself? Have you had any history of, mini-strokes or anything like that, along those lines? I know you're quite young.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, so after my, dad had his operation, I was required to be checked, and my cholesterol <UNIN/>, was fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Good, excellent. So you had a, a blood test done. And did they check for diabetes as well?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: They checked my diabetes, my blood pressure and my, cholesterol, and the doctor said it was all OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fantastic, OK. Now, do you have any other illnesses at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No. Are you on any medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I take an aspirin, seventy five milligrams, once a day, but that's, because of something I read on the internet.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, so, why is that? Why do you take that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I think it's, meant to reduce your risk of stroke and heart attack.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do, have you ever told a doctor before, your GP, that you're on Aspirin?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes I took, I started to <UNIN/>, taking it after my, father had his operation, but that wasn't the doctor telling me.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, and, has any GP ever spoken to you about, the risks of Aspirin, and whether you should be on it? Or have you not <UNIN/>, told the <UNIN/>, the GP in the past?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I haven't.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You haven't, OK. Um, all right. Um. Now, um, in terms of your uh, your kind of social situation. Um, are you working at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, I am.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, what do you work as?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I'm, uh, I'm actually a doctor.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You're a <UNIN/>, a, a medical doctor?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, which, <UNSURE>specialty</UNSURE> are you in?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I work in, <UNSURE>uh</UNSURE>, plastic surgery.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Plastic surgery, OK, great. And, um, do you, have any, um, allergies to any medication at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm allergic to penicillin only.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, um, are you, um, living alone?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I live with my wife.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Um, fantastic. Uh <UNIN/>, do you smoke at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Um, that's fine. Now, obviously you're a, you're a medic yourself. Did you have any thoughts as to what might be going on?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I've <UNSURE>actually</UNSURE>, got no idea.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Um, well the, the way you're describing these episodes. They make me concerned about, mini-strokes or TIAs, <UNIN/>, transient ischemic attacks. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And so, that's something quite urgent. And given that you've got a family history of um, stroke.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, even though you're quite young, I think um, it's something that we need to exclude. So, what I'm probably going to do, uh, in fact what I am going to do, is I'm going to, refer you to a stroke, a TIA clinic.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, now just to double-check. Do you have the symptoms right now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I'm perfectly fine at the moment.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, so, what I'm gonna do, is I'm uh, I'm gonna refer you to a, a mini-stroke clinic, or a TIA clinic.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, I send that referral off now, and then you can attend them, they, they'll usually, call you in within the next one to two days, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Because it's something relatively urgent. Now, today it's Wednesday, so we've got a few days <UNIN/>, before the weekend. So, um, uh, basically the deadline should be, Thursday, Friday.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We're expecting you to be seen by the time, that's the kind of turnaround we're, we're looking at.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And in that clinic, they'll be doing a number of things. Um, they'll be checking, they'll be doing <UNSURE>a</UNSURE> ultrasound of the, carotid arteries, like your, your father had. Um, and, they'll be doing a, maybe a, they might do a scan of your brain as well, to check if there's <UNSURE>any</UNSURE> signs of a bleed there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But, um, they'll be doing a range of tests in a short time frame, in order to exclude whether, you have um, any illness. OK, whether you <UNSURE>have</UNSURE> got any kind of stroke or, mini-stroke.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Now, if your symptoms return and they persist, <UNSURE>they're prolonged</UNSURE>. Then um, you may need to attend A and E.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, because um, our presumptive, working diagnosis <UNSURE>is</UNSURE>, mini-stroke or TIA, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And if, a mini-stroke is prolonged then uh, then we end up thinking that this might be a stroke and in that case, that becomes even more of an emergency. So, we're not talking about waiting one or two days, we want you to go to hospital in that instance, as soon as possible, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Now if <UNIN/>, things happen again, feel free to contact us, we can assess you over the phone, we can give you direction and guidance over the phone. That's, that's, that's not a problem, you know, you, you've got easy access to us.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, um, this is the plan going forward. Um, I'm going to, um, do that referral.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You should hear back from the hospital, relatively soon.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: The hospital, you can actually ring them, on um, uh, the <UNSURE>PALS</UNSURE> number, and then there's also the TIA clinic number.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm going to leave that number in the notes for this consultation, OK. So you'll have all the information you need, to chase this appointment.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And um, if you want, you can ring them, either today or tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, today in the afternoon, wait uh, one or two hours. Or tomorrow morning just to find out when they <UNSURE>got</UNSURE> time to slot you in. And, just to make sure they've got you in the system, that they've got in the books, and they're going to be calling you in, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, this isn't, <UNSURE>a</UNSURE>, an immediate emergency that you need to rush down to A and E. But it's something quite urgent we need to, deal with in a short space of time, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So if there's, if there's any delay that, transpires for example, you can't make the appointment or, you know, they, you don't get called. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, you, you get, get in contact back, back with us, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. Did you have any questions at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I think that covers, most of it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, great. So just bear with me a few minutes, and then I'll send that uh, all through and then you should, um, you should be able to <UNSURE>help</UNSURE>, you should have the information at your hands to, in order to take things further, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All the best. Take care now. Bye bye.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>
